direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods involve converting a document structure (jsoup to W3C or W3C to string) with similar control flows and exception handling.
Both methods process W3C documents but perform different operations (serialization vs. XPath evaluation).
The asString method relies on the W3C Document created by the convert method, indicating a strong dependency.
Both methods handle data conversion from one format to another (Map to Properties in asString, and jsoup to W3C in propertiesFromMap).
Both methods handle null parameters and throw exceptions in a similar manner.
